title: Attribution Regularization for Multimodal Paradigms
abstract: arXiv:2404.02359v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Multimodal machine learning has gained significant attention in recent years due to its potential for integrating information from multiple modalities to enhance learning and decision-making processes. However, it is commonly observed that unimodal models outperform multimodal models, despite the latter having access to richer information. Additionally, the influence of a single modality often dominates the decision-making process, resulting in suboptimal performance. This research project aims to address these challenges by proposing a novel regularization term that encourages multimodal models to effectively utilize information from all modalities when making decisions. The focus of this project lies in the video-audio domain, although the proposed regularization technique holds promise for broader applications in embodied AI research, where multiple modalities are involved. tldr: 提出一种新的正则化项，鼓励多模态模型有效利用所有模态信息，以解决多模态学习中单模态模型优于多模态模型的问题。
en_tdlr: Introducing a new regularization term to encourage multimodal models to effectively utilize information from all modalities, addressing the issue where unimodal models outperform multimodal models in multimodal learning.
